image.altText: A man holds a finger up to a woman holding a thong over her head. Cameras are around them.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for former constable Zachary Rolfe have called for members of the public who allegedly threatened him outside court to be arrested.

title.children: Rolfe's lawyers call for arrests after alleged threats outside court

image.altText: Police officer looks away from camera at a press conference

props.synopsis: Commissioner Michael Murphy has confirmed inquires will be undertaken into explosive racism claims made by former constable Zachary Rolfe at the Kumanjayi Walker coronial inquest.

title.children: NT Police entrenched racism claims investigated as identity of high-ranking officers suppressed

image.altText: A man in a business shirt and tie looks seriously off the camera.

props.synopsis: Here's what happened when former Northern Territory police officer Zachary Rolfe took the stand for the first time in the coronial inquest into the 2019 police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker. WARNING: This story contains offensive language.

title.children: From racism claims to emotional scenes: The key moments of Zachary Rolfe's inquest evidence

image.altText: Scott Morrison gestures while standing in the House of Representatives

props.synopsis: Former prime minister Scott Morrison has delivered his final speech in parliament before he retires from politics. Follow live.

title.children: Gender pay gap in focus in Question Time after Morrison says farewell

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Some unapologetic religion — and a nod to the Sharks
Lessons from Morrison's time in parliament
Morrison references Taylor Swift in honour of his daughters

image.altText: Sydney couple luke davies and jesse baird were allegedly murdered on Monday February 19

props.synopsis: It's been almost a week since NSW Police began investigating the alleged double murder of Sydney couple Luke Davies and Jesse Baird. Here's what we know so far.

title.children: Police expand search in alleged murder of Sydney couple to Royal National Park

image.altText: A school photo of a teacher in a school photo with young students. The kids faces are blurred

props.synopsis: After six months examining decades of crimes against students in state-run schools, the government-initiated inquiry leading the investigation delivers its findings to the Victorian governor.

title.children: In the early 70s, four paedophiles taught together at this school. Survivors say it was a sign of an insidious crisis

image.altText: A woman walks along the footpath of an empty street in front of construction sites for residential buildings in the Kangbashi district of the town of Ordos in China's Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region

props.synopsis: After China's property market implosion, there are growing fears its banking and financial system may be impacted too. It's further proof that China's economy is unravelling at a pace previously thought unimaginable, writes Ian Verrender.

title.children: China's economy is unravelling at a pace previously thought unimaginable. Where does that leave Australia?

image.altText: Graphic of different company logos as squares with a graph in the middle

props.synopsis: The gender pay gap — the difference between what men and women are paid in the same organisation — is a stubborn problem. Now, explosive new data from a government agency lets 5 million workers know the gap at their employer.

title.children: Gender pay shock as big gaps revealed in what men and women earn at nation's biggest companies

image.altText: A woman holds up a pink dress and looks at it thoughtfully in a clothing store.

props.synopsis: How can brands that market to women, sell to women, exist on the goodwill and support of women, pay them so much less than men, asks Daniel Ziffer.

title.children: The companies that take lots of money from women, but don't give so much back

image.altText: Xi Jinping raises his glass and proposes a toast while standing behind a lecturn in front of Chinese flags.

props.synopsis: The ABC understands that China is on track to lift wine tariffs it had placed on Australian at the end of March, after Trade Minister Don Farrell met with his Chinese counterpart Wang Wentao overnight.

title.children: China wine tariffs expected to be gone by end of March after trade minister meets with Chinese counterpart

image.altText: Taylor Swift, and Scott Swift cheer while watching the game at Gillette Stadium on December 17, 2023

props.synopsis: Sydney paparazzo photographer Ben McDonald says Scott Swift assaulted him after his daughter had disembarked a cruise on Sydney Harbour.

title.children: 'He's punched me in the face': Sydney photographer accuses Taylor Swift's father of assault

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair looks to the side, as a man in a suit stares ahead.

props.synopsis: WA Liberal Leader Libby Mettam sacks her deputy leader Steve Thomas after it emerges he engaged with disgraced former premier Brian Burke.

title.children: WA Liberal leader Libby Mettam sacks her deputy over 'disappointing' Brian Burke interaction

image.altText: A closed roller door on a drive-thru bottle shop, with concrete bollards out the front.

props.synopsis: Central Australia's peak tourism body says relaxing bottle shop restrictions is necessary to save the tourism industry with some members reporting a 50 per cent drop in trade since opening hours were reduced.

title.children: Tourism body urges NT government to wind back Alice Springs alcohol restrictions

image.altText: A tree hangs over a deserted stretch of beach.

props.synopsis: Police have launched an investigation. The deceased is yet to be formally identified.

title.children: Woman's body found on popular Gold Coast beach

image.altText: A winding metal slide twists through lush Australian bushland.

props.synopsis: The unique sinkhole in Tasmania's remote north-west was meant to be a much-needed tourism drawcard for the area. Instead, the site has fallen into disrepair, leaving locals shocked at its condition.

title.children: It was to be a tourism drawcard, but it's been 'left to rot' — and locals want to know why

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art

image.altText: A police officer at a checkpoint directs motorists lined up at Queensland-NSW border at Coolangatta.

props.synopsis: Dozens of Queensland Police Service and Queensland Ambulance Service staff challenged their workplace mandates in the Supreme Court in 2022, after they refused to comply with the directives.

title.children: Mandating COVID-19 vaccines for some Queensland frontline workers was unlawful, judge rules

image.altText: A woman in a blue police shirt stares ahead

props.synopsis: Karen Webb addressed concerns on her leadership and presence following the investigation into the deaths of Sydney couple Jesse Baird and Luke Davies with lyrics to Taylor Swift song Shake It Off.

title.children: 'Haters gonna hate': Police commissioner defends handling of alleged double murder with Taylor Swift lyrics

image.altText: Six young people stand on a stage lit with neon lights. The sign behind them has the TikTok logo on it.

props.synopsis: When an Australian streamer told us she was living off thousands of dollars of fan donations on TikTok, it seemed like a sign of something new happening on social media.

title.children: How an exclusive TikTok party put us on the trail of millions of dollars being donated to streamers

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Why is it so hard to study what's happening on social media?
Who has all this money to give away?
What's the attraction of giving money to strangers on the internet?

image.altText: Bottles of milk in a fridge

props.synopsis: A dairy industry advocate says Woolworths' decision to stop selling Norco milk in its Sydney stores shows big supermarkets "don't give a stuff" about the consumer or the farmer.

title.children: Woolworths' Sydney milk shut out a 'huge blow' to Norco farmers

image.altText: Close-up photo of woman with brown hair and denim collar smiling with mouth closed.

props.synopsis: According to new research perinatal depression and anxiety is one of the leading causes of maternal death in Australia. It's a shocking statistic. How can it be turned around?

title.children: Women are dying from perinatal depression and anxiety. What can be done about it?

image.altText: A composite image of two people lying in hospital beds.

props.synopsis: The number of Australians who received a kidney from a living donor was back to pre-COVID levels last year, helped along by a record year for a program that allows people to donate to strangers.

title.children: Nico gave his kidney to a stranger to save his wife Belinda — and other anonymous donors are doing the same

image.altText: Image of Joe Biden talking, he is wearing a blue suit with a tie with tiny donkeys on it. Behind him are green leaves .

props.synopsis: As Israel and Hamas take part in talks in Qatar, US President Joe Biden says he is hopeful of a ceasefire in Gaza within days.

title.children: Biden hopeful Israel-Hamas talks in Qatar will secure ceasefire in Gaza

image.altText: Former Judge Margaret McMurdo in a red suit in front of a projector showing the faces of the four men who perished in the crash.

props.synopsis: The timeline of events surrounding a Taipan helicopter crash that claimed the lives of four Defence personnel last year has been detailed for the first time.

title.children: Timeline of events surrounding fatal Taipan helicopter crash detailed for first time

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A close up photo taken by a lunar lander near the surface of the Moon

props.synopsis: A private US Moon lander is expected to stop working days before originally planned, while a Japanese one is again showing signs of life.

title.children: US Moon lander mission cut short after landing sideways as Japan's lander survives another lunar night

image.altText: Container full of nicotine pouches

props.synopsis: Health authorities are concerned about the illegal sale of a new nicotine product luring in young people and gaining traction across Australia.

title.children: What are nicotine pouches? Are they safe to use, and why has the government banned them?

image.altText: Sydney Mardi Gras

props.synopsis: The board of the Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras has requested that NSW Police not take part in this weekend's parade.

title.children: Mardi Gras board under pressure to reverse decision of asking police not to march during Sydney parade

image.altText: Smoke and an orange glow from a fire burning in the Cherry Gardens area of the Adelaide Hills.

props.synopsis: A former Country Fire Service volunteer who deliberately lit fires in the Adelaide Hills three years ago has been condemned in court by the agency's current chief, who said the firebug's actions put the communities at risk of an "Ash Wednesday-type" disaster and had tarnished the reputation of the entire CFS.

title.children: CFS chief blasts former volunteer over deliberately-lit Adelaide Hills bushfire

image.altText: The front of a Coles supermarket. Underneath a large sign are displays of fruit and vegetables.

props.synopsis: Shares in Coles have surged despite its profit falling in the six months to December when its supermarket revenue was rising. Meanwhile the ASX is trading lower after the major Wall Street indices finished flat. Follow live.

title.children: Coles shares surge despite half-year profit falling as supermarket revenue rose, ASX trading lower

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Woodside annual profit drops as weak prices offset higher sales
ASX  edges lower as investors focus on inflation data
Coles profit falls despite supermarket revenue increase, shares surge

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is a "terrifying" threat to democratic order thanks to his "creepy" embrace of autocrats such as Vladimir Putin, according to former prime minister Malcolm Turnbull.

title.children: Trump's 'creepy' Putin relationship a threat, Turnbull says

image.altText: Side by side photos of Joe Biden in front of an American flag and Taylor Swift looking over her shoulder

props.synopsis: With the number of eyes fixed on Taylor Swift’s glittering ascension, any political figure who would dismiss her as a woman unaware of her own power — or unprepared to wield it — would be a fool, writes Julia Baird.

title.children: Inside the 'holy war' against Taylor Swift and the men driving it

image.altText: Large thick billows of white smoke rise from the hills, with a house in the foreground.

props.synopsis: People living in communities near the Bayindeen bushfire in Victoria's north-west have been told to leave before midday Wednesday, ahead of predicted catastrophic fire conditions.

title.children: Tomorrow could be one of Victoria's most dangerous fire days in years, premier warns

image.altText: Custody photo of an Aboriginal man, staring directly into the camera.

props.synopsis: Three police officers have faced disciplinary action after an internal investigation into their actions the night a Kimberley man killed his partner.

title.children: Police punish officers over triple-0 call failings the night Warrick Walkerbear killed his partner

image.altText: A man in a blue polo and bald head smiles while leaning against a wooden bench with a house behind

props.synopsis: Property prices in the Wide Bay region that includes Bundaberg, Hervey Bay, and Maryborough have jumped between 65-75 per cent in the past five years, according to the latest CoreLogic report.

title.children: Beaches, backyards, and hot weather are why this region's seeing a 75pc jump in property prices

image.altText: Steve Smith holds his bat on his shoulder

props.synopsis: Steve Smith's future as a T20 opener for Australia seems over, but he is embracing his role as a Test opener ahead of the first five-day game with New Zealand.

title.children: Smith 'not too fussed' about T20 role, focused on New Zealand challenge in Wellington

image.altText: Flooded Eugowra on a clear sky afternoon at sunset

props.synopsis: When the people of Eugowra were faced with the task of rebuilding their town in the wake of the devastating flash flood in 2022, the locals vowed to learn from the misfortunes of other communities. They say it's worked.

title.children: How savvy planning and community spirit have helped this town rebuild after floods
